overview_of_class: An introduction to basic group theory: definition of a group; examples; subgroups; normal subgroups and quotient groups; homomorphisms and automorphisms; Cayley's theorem; permutation groups; Sylow's theorem: direct products; finite abelian groups. Groups and their structure, elementary ring theory; polynomial rings. 331 differs from 330 in two respects: it covers more topics in more depth, and aims at intensive development of students' ability to analyze and create mathematical proofs.
name: MENU: Abstract Algebra
subject: MATH
